title: Microsoft Teams voice calls abused to push Matanbuchus malware
summary: The Matanbuchus malware loader has been seen being distributed through social engineering over Microsoft Teams calls impersonating IT helpdesk. [...]

title: Google sues to disrupt BadBox 2.0 botnet infecting 10 million devices
summary: Google has filed a lawsuit against the anonymous operators of the Android BadBox 2.0 malware botnet, accusing them of running a global ad fraud scheme against the company's advertising platforms. [...]

title: LameHug malware uses AI LLM to craft Windows data-theft commands in real-time
summary: A novel malware family named LameHug is using a large language model (LLM) to generate commands to be executed on compromised Windows systems. [...]

title: Hackers Use GitHub Repositories to Host Amadey Malware and Data Stealers, Bypassing Filters
summary:
Threat actors are leveraging public GitHub repositories to host malicious payloads and distribute them via Amadey as part of a campaign observed in April 2025.

title: Hacker steals $27 million in BigONE exchange crypto breach
summary: Cryptocurrency exchange BigONE announced that it suffered a security breach, in which hackers stole various digital assets valued at $27 million. [...]

title: Chinese hackers breached National Guard to steal network configurations
summary: The Chinese state-sponsored hacking group known as Salt Typhoon breached and remained undetected in a U.S. Army National Guard network for nine months in 2024, stealing network configuration files and administrator credentials that could be used to compromise other government networks. [...]

title: Max severity Cisco ISE bug allows pre-auth command execution, patch now
summary: A critical vulnerability (CVE-2025-20337) in Cisco's Identity Services Engine (ISE) could be exploited to let an unauthenticated attacker store malicious files, execute arbitrary code, or gain root privileges on vulnerable devices. [...]

title: Hackers Exploit Apache HTTP Server Flaw to Deploy Linuxsys Cryptocurrency Miner
summary:
Cybersecurity researchers have discovered a new campaign that exploits a known security flaw impacting Apache HTTP Server to deliver a cryptocurrency miner called Linuxsys.
The vulnerability in question is CVE-2021-41773 (CVSS score: 7.5), a high-severity path traversal vulnerability in Apache HTTP

title: Europol Disrupts NoName057(16) Hacktivist Group Linked to DDoS Attacks Against Ukraine
summary:
An international operation coordinated by Europol has disrupted the infrastructure of a pro-Russian hacktivist group known as NoName057(16) that has been linked to a string of distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks against Ukraine and its allies.
